DataElement.preferredName: Subjective Numeracy Scale How Good Calculating 15 Percent Tip Score_6 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated perception of how good he/she is at calculating a 15% tip, using a six-point likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Subjective Numeracy Scale How Good Calculating 15 Percent Tip
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A self-report measure of perceived ability to perform various mathematical tasks and preference for the use of numerical versus prose information. The 8-item scale contains no mathematics questions and has no correct or incorrect answers. Instead, it consists of 4 questions asking respondents to assess their numerical ability in different contexts and 4 questions asking them to state their preferences for the presentation of numerical and probabilistic information. (Fagerlin, et al., Medical Decision Making, 2007: 27: 672-680)_A survey question about how proficient a person is with calculating a 15% tip.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A self-report measure of perceived ability to perform various mathematical tasks and preference for the use of numerical versus prose information. The 8-item scale contains no mathematics questions and has no correct or incorrect answers. Instead, it consists of 4 questions asking respondents to assess their numerical ability in different contexts and 4 questions asking them to state their preferences for the presentation of numerical and probabilistic information. (Fagerlin, et al., Medical Decision Making, 2007: 27: 672-680)

Concepts.definition: A self-report measure of perceived ability to perform various mathematical tasks and preference for the use of numerical versus prose information. The 8-item scale contains no mathematics questions and has no correct or incorrect answers. Instead, it consists of 4 questions asking respondents to assess their numerical ability in different contexts and 4 questions asking them to state their preferences for the presentation of numerical and probabilistic information. (Fagerlin, et al., Medical Decision Making, 2007: 27: 672-680)

Property.preferredDefinition: A survey question about how proficient a person is with calculating a 15% tip.

Concepts.definition: A question about how proficient an individual is with calculating a 15 percent tip.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric code to represent how good something is using a six-point Likert scale.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Modified long name and definition to meet quality criteria prior to release as part of caDSR clean up. mc 7/1/12

ReferenceDocuments.name: How good are you at calculati
ReferenceDocuments.description: How good are you at calculating a 15% tip?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Scoring Instructions
ReferenceDocuments.description: All questions scored as marked (1-6) except Question 7 which is reverse coded (6-1). SNS: Average rating across all 8 questions (w/ Q7 reverse coded) SNS ability subscale: Average rating on Questions 1-4 SNS preference subscale: Average rating on Questions 5-8 (w/ Q7 reverse coded)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Author Names
ReferenceDocuments.description: Fagerlin A, Zikmund-Fisher BJ, Ubel PA, Jankovic A, Derry HA, Smith DM

ReferenceDocuments.name: Measure Citation
ReferenceDocuments.description: Measuring numeracy without a math test: Development of the Subjective Numeracy Scale (SNS). Medical Decision Making, 2007: 27: 672-680.

DataElement.changeDescription: Modified long name/definition and added question text to meet quality criteria and released as part of caDSR cleanup. mc 7/2/12
